text: William Morrow) Male and Female is a 1949 comparative study of tribal men and women on seven Pacific islands and men and women in the contemporary (late 1940s) United States by anthropologist Margaret Mead. ==Publication data== *Mead, Margaret. Male and Female: The Classic Study of the Sexes (1949) Quill (HarperCollins) 1998 edition: , 477 pages, introduction by Mary Catherine Bateson Category:1949 non-fiction books Category:Anthropology books Category:Books by Margaret Mead Category:Gender studies books Category:William Morrow and Company books
title: Male and Female (book)
